pt: {sc}meager{/sc} {sc}scanty{/sc} {sc}scant{/sc} {sc}skimpy{/sc} {sc}spare{/sc} {sc}sparse{/sc} mean falling short of what is normal, necessary, or desirable. {sc}meager{/sc} implies the absence of elements, qualities, or numbers necessary to a thing's richness, substance, or potency.
{sc}scanty{/sc} stresses insufficiency in amount, quantity, or extent.

pt.t: supplies too {it}scanty{/it} to last the winter

pt: {sc}scant{/sc} suggests a falling short of what is desired or desirable rather than of what is essential.

pt.t: in January the daylight hours are {it}scant{/it}

pt: {sc}skimpy{/sc} usually suggests niggardliness or penury as the cause of the deficiency.
{sc}spare{/sc} may suggest a slight falling short of adequacy or merely an absence of superfluity.
{sc}sparse{/sc} implies a thin scattering of units.

et: Latin {it}sparsus{/it} spread out, from past participle of {it}spargere{/it} to scatter {ma}{mat|spark|}{/ma}
shortdef: of few and scattered elements; especially : not thickly grown or settled
